Hear<S>8085</S> this word<S>1697</S> that the LORD<S>3068</S> hath spoken<S>1696</S> against you, O children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>, against the whole family<S>4940</S> which I brought up<S>5927</S> from the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, saying<S>559</S>,
You only have I known<S>3045</S> of all the families<S>4940</S> of the earth<S>127</S>: therefore I will punish<S>6485</S> you for all your iniquities<S>5771</S>. <sup>punish: Heb. visit upon</sup>
Can two<S>8147</S> walk<S>3212</S> together<S>3162</S>, except<S>1115</S> they be agreed<S>3259</S>?
Will a lion<S>738</S> roar<S>7580</S> in the forest<S>3293</S>, when he hath no prey<S>2964</S>? will a young lion<S>3715</S> cry out<S>5414</S> <S>6963</S> of his den<S>4585</S>, if he have taken<S>3920</S> nothing<S>1115</S>? <sup>cry: Heb. give forth his voice</sup>
Can a bird<S>6833</S> fall<S>5307</S> in a snare<S>6341</S> upon the earth<S>776</S>, where no gin<S>4170</S> is for him? shall one take up<S>5927</S> a snare<S>6341</S> from the earth<S>127</S>, and have taken<S>3920</S> nothing at all<S>3920</S>?
Shall a trumpet<S>7782</S> be blown<S>8628</S> in the city<S>5892</S>, and the people<S>5971</S> not be afraid<S>2729</S>? shall there be evil<S>7451</S> in a city<S>5892</S>, and the LORD<S>3068</S> hath not done<S>6213</S> it? <sup>be afraid: or, run together? the LORD: or, shall not the L.doe somewhat?</sup>
Surely the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> will do<S>6213</S> nothing<S>1697</S>, but he revealeth<S>1540</S> his secret<S>5475</S> unto his servants<S>5650</S> the prophets<S>5030</S>.
The lion<S>738</S> hath roared<S>7580</S>, who will not<S>3808</S> fear<S>3372</S>? the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> hath spoken<S>1696</S>, who can but prophesy<S>5012</S>?
Publish<S>8085</S> in the palaces<S>759</S> at Ashdod<S>795</S>, and in the palaces<S>759</S> in the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, and say<S>559</S>, Assemble<S>622</S> yourselves upon the mountains<S>2022</S> of Samaria<S>8111</S>, and behold<S>7200</S> the great<S>7227</S> tumults<S>4103</S> in the midst<S>7130</S> thereof, and the oppressed<S>6217</S> in the midst<S>8432</S> thereof. <sup>oppressed: or, oppressions</sup>
For they know<S>3045</S> not to do<S>6213</S> right<S>5229</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, who store<S>686</S> up violence<S>2555</S> and robbery<S>7701</S> in their palaces<S>759</S>. <sup>robbery: or, spoil</sup>
Therefore thus saith<S>559</S> the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S>; An adversary<S>6862</S> there shall be even round about<S>5439</S> the land<S>776</S>; and he shall bring down<S>3381</S> thy strength<S>5797</S> from thee, and thy palaces<S>759</S> shall be spoiled<S>962</S>.
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; As the shepherd<S>7462</S> taketh out<S>5337</S> of the mouth<S>6310</S> of the lion<S>738</S> two<S>8147</S> legs<S>3767</S>, or a piece<S>915</S> of an ear<S>241</S>; so shall the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> be taken out<S>5337</S> that dwell<S>3427</S> in Samaria<S>8111</S> in the corner<S>6285</S> of a bed<S>4296</S>, and in Damascus<S>1833</S> in a couch<S>6210</S>. <sup>taketh: Heb. delivereth</sup> <sup>in Damascus: or, on the bed's feet</sup>
Hear<S>8085</S> ye, and testify<S>5749</S> in the house<S>1004</S> of Jacob<S>3290</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S>, the God<S>430</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>,
That in the day<S>3117</S> that I shall visit<S>6485</S> the transgressions<S>6588</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> upon him I will also visit<S>6485</S> the altars<S>4196</S> of Bethel<S>1008</S>: and the horns<S>7161</S> of the altar<S>4196</S> shall be cut off<S>1438</S>, and fall<S>5307</S> to the ground<S>776</S>. <sup>visit: or, punish Israel for</sup>
And I will smite<S>5221</S> the winter<S>2779</S> house<S>1004</S> with the summer<S>7019</S> house<S>1004</S>; and the houses<S>1004</S> of ivory<S>8127</S> shall perish<S>6</S>, and the great<S>7227</S> houses<S>1004</S> shall have an end<S>5486</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
